ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt more Portuguese grammar and vocabulary that can be used in both conversational and written settings.
I learned a lot about Brazilian art and culture. I learned some grammar concepts but not very many. I learned vocabulary having to do witb art and culture.
I got a lot better at my speaking and writing skills in Portuguese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I have nothing but praise for this class. The professor is outstanding. For such a junior faculty member/graduate student, he led class discussions and language learning in a profound yet understandable way, making sure to connect our language learning to lusophone culture at every turn.

Professor Osterbrock is very kind and responsive to student input and tries his best to make class interesting and fun. That said, because there is no textbook, the class is fairly unorganized. I wish we could have learned more grammar in a more structured way, with vocabulary lists as well.
I love that the class is laid back and focused on helping you actually master the language and enjoy the process.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly. The Portuguese department is excellent, and very committed to student learning. The class is organised well to learn Portuguese.
Yes! I love the Portuguese department at Yale! It is such an inclusive and encouraging community.
